instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-5482: What is 820-5482? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-5482</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing caps
threads.message: Hi there fellow techs, I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-5482</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> I/O board with blowing caps, are there schematics for the board or can anyone please tell me specs of them? 2 caps that are missing on [URL="https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/23551-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-short-on-<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>"]<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>[/URL] rail. [ATTACH alt="Click image for larger version  Name:	image1.JPG Views:	1 Size:	600.8 KB ID:	23659" type="full" width="30%"]23659._xfImport[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-5482</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing caps
threads.message: They are just on the 5V line to the USB. I also see burn damage to the PCB. Just don't bother with this as there may be more damage than this. The board should even work just fine without the caps. This was probably caused by a voltage spike on the USB ports.
